standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: We estimate to add, subtract, multiply, and divide with friendly numbers.  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 5 to 6 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 5.1 appears between tick mark 5 and an unlabeled tick mark representing 5.5. An arrow begins at the point 5.1 and moves left to tick mark 5.

A number line labeled 4 to 5 with tick marks every one-half unit. A point labeled 4.9 appears between an unlabeled tick mark representing 4.5 and tick mark 5. An arrow begins at the point 4.9 and moves right to tick mark 5.

hints.content: We estimate to add, subtract, multiply, and divide with friendly numbers.  [[☃ explanation 1]]
